title: Minimum Spanning Tree Algorithms
subject: Algorithms
theory:
A subgraph that connects all vertices with min total edge weight and NO cycles. 
Algorithms: Prim's (vertex based), Kruskal's (edge based).

interview_questions.question: Can MST have cycles?
interview_questions.answer: No. Trees are acyclic by definition.

real_world_use_cases.description: Connect all cities with min cable length.

exam_notes: Unique only if edge weights distinct.
